history.content:
Considering the demand for this class currently (its almost full currently), it is quite unlikely. I would not rely on it for a degree. That being said, if you are high on the waitlist, maybe you have a chance if enough people drop.

Here is last spring's website: https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1468734

Considering the demand for this class currently (its almost full currently), it is quite unlikely. I would not rely on it for a degree. That being said, if you are high on the waitlist, maybe you have a chance if enough people drop.

Hi, I'm a senior (non-CS major) and I was placed 16th on the waitlist for CS182. Since the class is only 187 people, what are my chances of getting into the course? Is there any chance the class will get expanded by a small amount?

Also, getting the CS minor for me is contingent on whether or not I get into this class, so since I am graduating in Spring 2019, should I still fill out my minor petition before December (seeing as I would not know if I get into the class until adjustment period)? Finally, I wanted to know if there was anywhere I could find the syllabus for CS 182; I found old ones from before 2008 but I'm not sure if they are relevant. Thanks in advance!
history.subject: Waitlist for CS182 / CS Minor Question
